snippet: Arthur Caplan, who has built a career advising doctors on difficult moral issues, will help Johnson & Johnson decide which patients receive experimental drugs.
abstract: Profile of Arthur L Caplan, bioethicist appointed by Johnson & Johnson to create panel that will examine requests by desperately ill patients for experimental drugs; Caplan is not a medical doctor but has spent his entire career counseling medical professionals on thorny issues regarding ethics and morality.
